description: Ground floor rear and side extension and reconstruction of unsafe side chimney stacks.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
The external finishing materials shall match those used in the construction of the existing building and/or areas of hard surfacing. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans, as set out below:S1,3577/7E, 3577/8E.Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
Demolition work to the chimney shall be carried out by hand or by tools held in the hand and without the use of power-driven tools.Reason: In order to protect the integrity of the building.

All new brickwork for the reconstructed chimney, including any areas of making good, shall match the original in terms of brick type, bond, colour, texture, mortar mix, joint profile, and detailing, unless otherwise shown on the approved drawings. The works shall be carried out using materials and techniques that reflect the original construction, ensuring a consistent and sympathetic appearance.Reason: In order to preserve the character of the builidng and conservation area.
